references.paper_title: Panoramic video textures
references.reason: This paper is highly relevant because it is one of the earliest works to tackle the problem of creating panoramic videos, a task that the current paper directly addresses and improves upon. The authors present a solution to the panorama synthesis problem using graph cuts, addressing limitations of previous techniques.

references.paper_title: SinGAN-GIF: Learning a Generative Video Model from a Single GIF
references.reason: This paper introduces SinGAN-GIF, a generative model that can learn from a single GIF. While not directly a panoramic video method, its approach to learning from limited data is relevant as the proposed method must handle partially observed, incomplete panoramic videos.

references.paper_title: Lumiere: A space-time diffusion model for video generation
references.reason: Lumiere is a key component of the proposed method. As a powerful generative model, it is crucial for realistic video generation in the unknown regions of the panoramic video.  The paper's contribution is essential to the method's success in generating high-quality video.

references.paper_title: MultiDiffusion: Fusing Diffusion Paths for Controlled Image Generation
references.reason: This work contributes to the understanding of diffusion models, which are fundamental to the paper's methodology.  The concept of MultiDiffusion is directly applied in the proposed method to generate consistent results from multiple overlapping spatial windows.

references.paper_title: Stable video diffusion: Scaling latent video diffusion models to large datasets
references.reason: This paper discusses advancements in stable video diffusion, a topic highly relevant to the challenges addressed by the proposed method. By scaling the latent video diffusion models, the authors potentially improve the efficiency and scalability of the video generation process, which may be a direction of future work.

references.paper_title: Align your latents: High-resolution video synthesis with latent diffusion models
references.reason: Similar to the previous Blattmann et al. paper, this work is pertinent because it explores high-resolution video synthesis using latent diffusion models. This directly relates to the challenges and potential improvements for the quality of generated videos in the proposed method.

references.paper_title: Automatic Panoramic Image Stitching using Invariant Features
references.reason: This paper is a foundational work in image panorama stitching, providing a basis for understanding the challenges of creating panoramic images from multiple images. While the focus is on still images, understanding these techniques is essential for the related task of creating panoramic videos.

references.paper_title: The Laplacian pyramid as a compact image code
references.reason: This paper introduces the Laplacian pyramid, a multi-resolution image representation technique.  The Laplacian pyramid is implicitly used in many image processing tasks, including image blending, which is crucial for seamless integration of different parts of the panoramic video.

references.paper_title: Panoramic stereo video textures
references.reason: This paper expands on previous work on video textures to create panoramic stereo video textures. It is relevant as it deals with similar challenges of handling motion in panoramic videos, and the results presented can be compared with the proposed approach.

references.paper_title: Animatediff: Animate your personalized text-to-image diffusion models without specific tuning
references.reason: This paper introduces Animatediff, a method that can animate text-to-image diffusion models. The technique of animating diffusion models is highly relevant to the proposed method, which utilizes generative video models for video generation.  Future improvements may involve similar animation strategies.

references.paper_title: Imagen video: High definition video generation with diffusion models
references.reason: This paper introduces Imagen Video, a high-definition video generation model based on diffusion models.  The use of diffusion models is central to the proposed method. Understanding the capabilities and limitations of Imagen Video is crucial for the design and evaluation of the proposed approach.

references.paper_title: Denoising diffusion probabilistic models
references.reason: This paper lays the theoretical foundation for denoising diffusion probabilistic models, which are the underlying mechanism of the diffusion-based video generation models (like Lumiere) used in the proposed approach.  A solid understanding of this foundation is crucial for the proposed method's development and evaluation.

references.paper_title: A Survey on Data-Driven Video Completion
references.reason: This survey paper provides a broad overview of data-driven video completion techniques, which are highly relevant to the proposed method's task of completing the unknown regions of the panoramic video.  It contextualizes the specific challenges that the proposed method addresses.

references.paper_title: Multiple View Geometry in Computer Vision
references.reason: This book is a fundamental resource for computer vision techniques. The presented method relies on homographies, which are directly related to camera parameter estimation and image projection. The book provides essential background on these methods.

references.paper_title: Phenaki: Variable Length Video Generation from Open Domain Textual Descriptions
references.reason: Phenaki is the token-based generative video model utilized in the proposed method. Its ability to generate realistic videos of variable length and complexity is key to the method's success in synthesizing high-quality panoramic videos.  The paper's contribution is significant to the overall approach.

references.paper_title: Space-time completion of video
references.reason: This paper is highly relevant because it focuses on space-time completion of videos, which is directly related to the task addressed in the proposed paper. The proposed method aims to synthesize complete panoramic videos; techniques developed here can be directly applied.

references.paper_title: AVID: Any-Length Video Inpainting with Diffusion Model
references.reason: This paper introduces AVID, a method for any-length video inpainting using diffusion models. This is highly relevant to the proposed method as it demonstrates the capabilities and limitations of diffusion models for video inpainting.  It informs the design choices of the proposed method.

references.paper_title: Magicvideo: Efficient video generation with latent diffusion models
references.reason: This paper presents MagicVideo, an efficient video generation model using latent diffusion models.  It highlights advancements in efficient video generation, which is directly relevant to optimizing the computational cost of the proposed approach.  It informs the discussion on potential future improvements.

references.paper_title: ProPainter: Improving Propagation and Transformer for Video Inpainting
references.reason: This paper is relevant because it is one of the baseline video inpainting methods used for comparison against the proposed VidPanos method. By comparing results with ProPainter, the authors demonstrate the advancements achieved by VidPanos in generating realistic video panoramas.

references.paper_title: Towards An End-to-End Framework for Flow-Guided Video Inpainting
references.reason: This paper is relevant as it introduces another baseline method for comparison against the proposed VidPanos method. By comparing results with this end-to-end flow-guided framework, the authors highlight the superior performance of their approach.
